voiceactivity.lib
Class VoiceActivity

java.lang.Object
  android.content.Context
      android.content.ContextWrapper
          android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
              android.app.Activity
                  voiceactivity.lib.VoiceActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.speech.RecognitionListener, android.speech.tts.TextToSpeech.OnInitListener, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback
Direct Known Subclasses:
VoiceSearch
public abstract class VoiceActivity
extends android.app.Activity
implements android.speech.RecognitionListener, android.speech.tts.TextToSpeech.OnInitListener

Abstract class for voice interaction that encapsulates the management of the ASR and TTS engines. It contains abstract methods for processing the ASR and TTS events that may occur, which may be implemented in a non-abstract subclass to carry out a detailed management.

Version:
1.0, 02/19/14
Author:
Zoraida Callejas, Michael McTear
See Also:
http://developer.android.com/reference/android/speech/tts/TextToSpeech.html, http://developer.android.com/reference/android/speech/tts/UtteranceProgressListener.html

RecognitionListener.java

listen

public void listen(java.util.Locale language,
                   java.lang.String languageModel,
                   int maxResults)
            throws java.lang.Exception
Starts speech recognition after checking the ASR parameters

Parameters:
language - Language used for speech recognition (e.g. Locale.ENGLISH)
languageModel - Type of language model used (free form or web search)
maxResults - Maximum number of recognition results
Throws:
An - exception is raised if the language specified is not available or the other parameters are not valid
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
OnLanguageDetailsListener.java, LanguageDetailsChecker.java

startASR

private void startASR(java.lang.String language,
                      java.lang.String languageModel,
                      int maxResults)
Actually starts speech recognition once the parameters have been checked (invoked by the listen method)

Parameters:
language - Language used for speech recognition (e.g. Locale.ENGLISH)
languageModel - Type of language model used (free form or web search)
maxResults - Maximum number of recognition results

This class implements the RecognitionListener interface, thus it implement its methods. However not all of them were interesting to us: ******************************************************************************************************

setTTS

public void setTTS()
Starts the TTS engine. It is work-around to avoid implementing the UtteranceProgressListener abstract class.

See Also:
the problem here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/11703653/why-is-utteranceprogresslistener-not-an-interface

setLocale

public void setLocale(java.lang.String languageCode,
                      java.lang.String countryCode)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Sets the locale for speech synthesis taking into account the language and country codes If the countryCode is null, it just sets the language, if the languageCode is null, it uses the default language of the device If any of the codes are not valid, it uses the default language

Parameters:
languageCode - a String representing the language code, e.g. EN
countryCode - a String representing the country code for the language used, e.g. US.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when the codes supplied cannot be used and the default locale is selected

setLocale

public void setLocale(java.lang.String languageCode)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Sets the locale for speech synthesis taking into account the language code If the code is null or not valid, it uses the default language of the device

Parameters:
languageCode - a String representing the language code, e.g. EN
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when the code supplied cannot be used and the default locale is selected

setLocale

public void setLocale()
Sets the default language of the device as locale for speech synthesis

speak

public void speak(java.lang.String text,
                  java.lang.String languageCode,
                  java.lang.String countryCode,
                  java.lang.Integer id)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Synthesizes a text in the language indicated (or in the default language of the device it it is not available)

Parameters:
languageCode - language for the TTS, e.g. EN
countryCode - country for the TTS, e.g. US
text - string to be synthesized
id - integer that identifies the prompt uniquely
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when the codes supplied cannot be used and the default locale is selected

Synthesizes a text using the default language of the device

text - string to be synthesized
id - integer that identifies the prompt uniquely

stop

public void stop()
Stops the synthesizer if it is speaking

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Stops the speech synthesis engine. It is important to call it, as it releases the native resources used.
